content: How come , now that we are in a recession the American people are catching grief because we are saving money and not out spending it. They say we need to be consumers and go out and spend to help the economy get started again. But when things were good we were being chastized in the media because we were not putting money in the bank for a rainy day Seems like its your damned if you do and damned if you don't Just my Andy Rooney ism for the day

content: I don't own any stocks except for my government Thrift Savings Plan. I was wondering if I should buy stock in GM. I heard they are going for something silly like $1 per share. I just don't think the US will let GM go under. Believe me, I have no skills at all in the stock market but then again, neither do most of those folks that hang out on Wall St. each and every day. Don

content: There are plenty of investments out there that give you a very good return and guarantee your principle. I do not recommend that anybody get into the stock market unless they are willing to lose the money that is their initial investment. Almost all of my investments are outside the stock market. I do have an online account with Scottrade that I started a few years ago with a $500 initial investment. I now carry a $10,000 balance there. All earnings that exceed $10k I withdrawal and invest outside the stock market. Since September 2008 my stock market portfolio is up 15%. So, just because the market is down, that does not mean there isn't money to be made by investors. It is the speculators and gamblers that lose money. And, the buy and hold people are probably the biggest losers in this regard. As for savings, you can always make interest that exceeds inflation in certificates and money market accounts. You can't now because the rates are down. But, if you locked in a 5 year certificate 6 months ago with a 5% dividend that is compounded daily, you would be well above what inflation has been over the past decade. To say that those who save and/or invest in the markets would have less money today than a year ago only proves that you aren't knowledgeable on the subject.
